item.title: List of books I have read
Review: The Inner Game of Tennis
item.description: In the book ‘The Inner Game of Tennis’, author Timothy Gallway talks about different aspects of learning (or acquiring) a new skill. He argues that key to acquiring any new skill requires contribution from two distinct entities in your brain, which he calls Self-1 and Self-2.

item.title: Review: Burmese Days
item.description: It is one of the tragedies of the half-educated that they develop late, when they are already committed to some wrong way of life. George Orwell, Burmese Days Burmese Days by George Orwell My rating: 4 of 5 stars

item.title: Review: What is Life?
item.description: If a man never contradicts himself, the reason must be that he virtually never says anything at all. Erwin Schrödinger Written by Erwin Schrödinger, an eminent physicist and Nobel Prize winner, the book What is Life?
